Hyndland Primary Parent Council

Parent Noticeboard

Non-uniform for International Day

Friday 26th April To link with our International Day on Friday, pupils are asked to come to school wearing colours or clothes linked with a country either of their nationality or that they have links with. Pupils are encouraged to bring £1 for non-uniform day. The money this month will go towards Outdoor Learning. Our […]

Garden Volunteers

We’re delighted to have P2 mum Helen working alongside Amanda in the garden. If you fancy lending a hand too, contact Amanda to find out what you can do. We are approaching the sowing/planting season and it would be good to have some parent help in place. Please contact Amanda njstorey@globalnet.co.uk if you can offer […]

Parent Council Meeting

We had a great meeting on 24th April with lots of plans for playground improvements. If you’ve never been along to a Parent Council meeting, why not come and see how it works? Our last meeting of the school year is on Wednesday 15th May.

Quiz Night, Friday 26th April

Hyndland Bowling Club, Queensborough Gardens, 7.30pm Tickets £5 – Adults only – get your sitter sorted! ***Oops! Not long to purchase your tickets! Hurry, hurry, hurry!*** Hooray, at long last… a social event! Next week sees the return of our ever-popular Quiz Night. Regulars will know that it’s an opportunity to get together, have a […]

Donate to Parent Council

In response to requests for the ability to make donations to the Parent Council funds outwith events, we now have a PayPal account to allow parents, carers and wider families to donate towards resources for the school.

  • About

This website is for parents and carers of pupils at Hyndland Primary School and it is run by its Parent Council.

If you’d like to receive e-mail updates, please e-mail us and we can add you to the mailing list.

On the other hand, if you would like to contact the school directly, you can do so by calling them on 0141 339 7207

  • School Twitter

Website maintained by Hyndland Primary Parent Council & Ali Walker
